Description: A bracelet: composed of tiny disc beads of bright-blue glazed composition and larger standard cylinders of green glazed composition, sixteen tiny silver and gold disc beads, one long cylindrical bead of green glazed steatite and a green glazed composition Ḥeḥ-amulet.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Mostagedda, Grave 544 Found at the left wrist of a woman
Curator's comments: Also from this burial: bangle (1929,1015.468). girdles (1929,1015.470 & 1929,1015.471 & 1929,1015.472 & 1929,1015.473), necklaces (1929,1015.474 & 1929,1015.475). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 101-2; Tomb register, pl.XLVIII; Bead register. pl.XLIXA.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (309)
